channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: How can this be "resolved"!?, 18th July
item.description:
I reported this yesterday and it says "resolved" when it's a long-term issue, so clearly it wasn't resolved in less than 24 hours. What's the plan for trying to stop this from happening!?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: The dead fox case you closed its been bagged up for disposal, 18th July
item.description:
The fox had been hit at high speed. Its pelvis was shattered and it was still on the pavement outside the Waterloo block after midnight. I got an old denium wrap skirt, rolled it up in this and double bagged it. I did use gloves which are in the double bag to avoid contamination. Its back by the road in white bin bags with pink writing on and needs collecting. I just couldn't leave it any longer outside as it was gruesome for all walking by it was reported yesterday pm after 3pm and the case was closed. Please would the team collect it from outside the Waterloo Block on the curbside.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cooper Close, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
